children.subject: Well the idea is I'm trying to take the Math 54 + EE16A combo for my lower divs (since I was admitted before Fall 2017) and substitute Physics 111A for EE16A. Just for reference Physics 111A is a circuits class that requires 8-12 hours of lab work a week.

I believe EE16A has different content compared to Physics 111A.

EE16A has three modules, the first of which can generally be substituted by previous linear algebra knowledge. The other two however (the circuits and signal processing modules) cover things like nodal analysis, thevenin and norton equivalent circuits, analyzing complex circuits with op-amps, cross-correlation, OMP, etc, not to mention the python component of some of the labs. I believe Physics 111A covers some of the circuits topics, but from a different angle than this course.

Is there a reason why you don't want to take the class? The linear algebra portion might be repeated if you have already taken Math 54, but the other topics should be worth taking both courses.
Math 54 fulfills the EE16A CS requirement... [if you started Fall 2017 or later]. EE16B is still required though.

Buddy of mine took 111a a while ago and is taking EE16a this semester. He tells me 16a is a waste of time and highly regrets not trying to petition out of it (not an EECS major, but in COE). Worth a shot IMO. Especially since 111a is such a brutal class.
2nd Anon in discussion: Congrats! Glad to hear they're recognizing 111a worthy enough to waive.
Just to update this thread--I got EE16A waved with Physics 111A + Math 54 + Physics 7B :)

history.content: Is it possible to petition out of taking EE16A as part of the CS major requirement if I have taken Physics 111A and Math 54 which between the two of them cover every topic in EE16A.
history.subject: Physics 111A + Math 54 instead of EE16A
